articles.author: James Mackintosh
articles.summary: Investing in artificial intelligence is risky. The main bet is on artificial general intelligence, an AI that can match or surpass humans. The entry cost is high because of the race to AGI and the prospects for take-up of the less exciting propositions remain uncertain. The chips being bought today to fill the data centers will be redundant in 4-5 years.

articles.title: BTech In AI Or BTech In Data Science: Which One Should You Choose In 2025?
articles.author: NDTV
articles.summary: Students with strong analytical thinking, intellectual curiosity and an interest in solving societal or business problems through data will thrive in this field. articles.title: MasterClass founder says CEOs who are not using AI daily are only 80% as good as their peers—he's saved an entire day of work thanks to a custom GPT

articles.summary: David Rogier is a CEO who uses eight different AI tools to improve his productivity. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella uses GPT-5 within his 365 Copilot app to generate meeting summaries, project updates, monitor productivity and more. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang uses AI as both a learning and research tool.

articles.title: What AI Stock Could Be the Market's Best Bargain Today?

articles.summary: Alphabet is the parent company of Google. It uses AI in its search business and offers AI services to advertisers and cloud users. One Wall Street analyst considers it the most valuable AI company. Its stock is trading at a bargain price of 23 times forward earnings. As it gains ground in AI, its stock is likely to advance.

articles.title: With AI assistance, scientists are pushing limits of agricultural research

It brought more than 150 people together to hear how AI and machine learning are propelling research in multiple agricultural disciplines. The winning team of the AI in Ag Hackathon, a collaboration with Bayer Crop Science, were the Cultiv-AI-tors.

articles.summary: A trend has emerged in Russia of using artificial intelligence to create video memorials of the dead, often soldiers, giving a final farewell to their wives and children, using a combination of human and machine-generated content to create them. It's called "Artificial intelligence memorials".

The stock currently trades at an attractive forward earnings multiple of 20.

articles.title: The Rise Of Reverse Automation: What It Means For The Future Of Work
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Reverse automation describes how technology is creating new human-centered jobs in the spaces where machines fall short. It reshapes education, leadership, and opportunity in the areas where machines don't perform well. It's reshaping the world of education and leadership.

articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Google has released Gemini 2.5 Flash Image for general use. The model is now available for developers in production environments. It offers broader creative control with new AI-driven image generation and editing features.       for Google's toolkit for AI-powered images.

articles.summary: Quantum computers will solve problems that even most modern-day artificial intelligence platforms can't tackle. The technology can be used for nefarious purposes like hacking and password-cracking. International Business Machines is working on quantum computing technology. IBM has been working on its own quantum computing tech for some time and introduced the world's first commercial quantum computing system in 2019.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence is terrible at trading crypto. Here's what could change that
articles.author: Tim Craig
articles.summary: Nick Emmons is the co-founder and CEO of Allora Labs, a firm building a decentralised artificial intelligence network. His new AI agent traded a completely different asset than what it was supposed to do. AI-focused firms have raised over $500 million this year in the crypto industry. The market for AI agents is estimated to surpass $50 billion within the next five years. Google and Microsoft are investing in building their own AI agent platforms.

articles.title: TV Q&A: How is AI being used in film restoration?
articles.author: Rich Heldenfels
articles.summary: AI is being used for restoring silent films and repairing damage caused by wildfires. The Emmy-winning DRS Nova MTai FrameGen software uses artificial intelligence to reconstruct missing frames in damaged film reels. The second season of 'Mobland' was renewed for a second season in June. Season 3 of 'The White Lotus' was filmed in south of France.

articles.summary: OpenAI and Jony Ive are working on a screen-less, AI-powered device. They face significant technical challenges as they work to develop the device.   iReporter.com has more details on the development of the device and its technical challenges.

articles.summary: Adria Cimino predicts that Nvidia shares will reach $400 by 2030. Nvidia is a leading semiconductor company with a recent market cap of $4.6 trillion. articles.title: AI in Africa: UNESCO unveils new solutions for its development at the G20
articles.author: Capital Ethiopia
articles.summary: UNESCO plans to train 15,000 civil servants and 5,000 judicial personnel on artificial intelligence at the G20 conference on AI in Africa this week. UNESCO is unveiling a series of new innovative solutions and initiatives to enable the development of artificial intelligence on the continent while protecting human rights.

articles.title: The Rise Of Reverse Automation: What It Means For The Future Of Work
articles.author: Dr. Diane Hamilton
articles.summary: Reverse automation is about how technology creates new human-centered work where machines fall short. Harvard recently announced plans to explore new forms of workforce and technical training aimed at practical, skills-based education. The line between white-collar and blue-collar work is fading. Entrepreneurs are using reverse automation to revive overlooked markets.

articles.title: Skepticism on the rise for AI, as some fear impending bubble
articles.summary: In the first half of this year, companies spent more on artificial intelligence than on consumer spending. The U.S. economy expanded at a rate of 1.6% in that period. The stock market is near record highs, driven by the shares of technology companies that have put AI at the center of their business strategies. Some fear a potential bubble in AI investment.

articles.title: Software engineers see coding industry transformed by new AI assistants
articles.summary: Anthropic launched the latest version of its Claude chatbot on Monday. Anthropic's Claude Sonnet 4.5 was able to code autonomously for more than 30 hours on a project for London-based startup iGent. The top use case for AI chatbots is in coding and software engineering. San Francisco and the Bay Area remain the center of the competitive market.

The new AI-powered ad campaign consists of a ten-part series featuring ads with innovators from the past, including Benjamin Franklin, Marie Curie and Leonardo da Vinci.

articles.summary: Broadcom Inc. (NASDAQ:AVGO) is one of the best stocks to buy right now, according to Nancy Pelosi. KeyBanc Capital Markets reiterated an 'Overweight' rating on the stock and raised its price target to $420 from $400. Product discovery has undergone significant improvements since the prior release. Embedded images inside PDFs and decks are now searchable across more data sources.

articles.title: How the German government is going all in on AI
articles.summary: Chancellor's cabinet agreed to integrate AI into everyday use in the government's Modernization Agenda. It includes an online platform for export-based businesses to bundle information on export regulations and credit options, and expediting visa processing by using AI to review an applicant's documents. The Weimatar, an AI avatar of the State Minister for Culture and Media, can speak 100 languages.

articles.author: Cyprus Mail
articles.summary: OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT, has reached a valuation of $500 billion following a deal in which current and former employees sold roughly $6.6 billion worth of shares. This represents a bump-up from the company's current $300 billion valuation.

articles.title: Unveiling Secrets: Clues and Answers from October 5th
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: October 5th marks the founding of Microsoft. Bill Gates and Paul Allen developed the BASIC programming language for the first commercially successful personal computer, the Altair 8800, on October 5th, 1975. The BASIC interpreter was Microsoft's first commercial success. The company's focus on making computers accessible through user-kind programming languages like BASIC was crucial step in the digital revolution.

articles.title: A sudden swarm: Brazen lanternflies give entomophobia wings
articles.author: Kimberly Wynn
articles.summary: Aphobic is an AI-powered phobia relief app that was launched in July and offers round-the-clock access to a structured program. Spotted lanternflies have a presence in 18 states. Wood County in Ohio was added to the list of quarantine areas.

articles.title: Is AI a threat to jobs? A 'Tomb Raider' affair poses the question
articles.summary: Francois Cadol's voice was replaced by artificial intelligence in the August update of "Tomb Raider IV--VI Remastered" by a machine. The developer, Aspyr, has apologized for the inconvenience caused. Campaigners warn of the dangers AI poses to human workers and their jobs.

articles.title: AI Doctor: Risks & Future of Healthcare Automation
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: Half of all patients now turn to the internet or artificial intelligence chatbots for medical information. Experts warn that relying solely on AI for health decisions could have profound consequences, from delayed treatment to a growing disconnect from the human element of care. AI excels at processing vast amounts of data, identifying patterns, and assisting with tasks like image analysis and preliminary diagnosis. It's crucial to remember that it's a tool, not a replacement for qualified medical professionals.

articles.title: ‘Echo chamber': Worrying AI trend on the rise

articles.title: If Those Days Were Not Shortened
articles.author: Rolaant McKenzie
articles.summary: A.I. Artificial Intelligence is a 2001 American science fiction drama film based on the 1969 short story 'Supertoys Last All Summer Long' by Brian Aldiss. First-world nations have created advanced humanoid robots called mechas to fulfill various roles in society. David, a mecha designed by Cybertronics of New Jersey, became trapped underwater in the area of Coney Island when the Wonder Wheel fell on the vehicle. Two thousand years later, Manhattan is buried deep under glacial ice. Archeologists revived David and used their telekinetic powers to retrieve his memories. They told him that it would be impossible to make him human.

articles.title: Can AI replace your job? Here's what experts say

articles.summary: Linda Nazareth is an AI expert and futurist. She thinks that some skills can't be replaced by artificial intelligence (AI) and that others can be improved by AI. She tells us which skills she thinks are AI-proof and which are not.

articles.author: system

articles.summary: The University of Arkansas at Little Rock is offering three courses on artificial intelligence to help the community with using AI in their businesses and lives. The courses include a course on AI in business and AI in the individual lives.       .

articles.title: Will artificial intelligence help consumers save money or cost them more?
articles.author: File/AP
articles.summary: There are many AI-related products and services that claim to help consumers save money by using artificial intelligence. However, it's still too early to know what AI can do and what it's good or bad for. Delta Air Lines found that out after touting AI tools to investors.

articles.summary: A new study from Vantage Point Counseling reveals that 28% of U.S. adults have had some kind of intimate or romantic connection with an AI. ChatGPT, Character.ai, Alexa, Siri, and Gemini are the most popular AI platforms. People in satisfying real-life relationships are more likely to experiment with AI intimacy.

articles.title: Guerra: Willacy County is at the forefront of technology
articles.author: Ron Whitlock
articles.summary: Willacy County Judge Aurelio 'Keter' Guerra bragged about his upcoming project with Soluna, a company that converts excess wind, solar, and hydro energy into productive computational work. The company is building a $50 million 'green' data center on FM 1420 on the east side of Willacy County. It is expected to deliver 166 megawatts of clean computing for AI and Bitcoin. Guerra wants to start a dialogue with the real estate experts in the audience. He wants them to know his county is ready for development.
